definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)

sentences.english: Their "standing in the spirit of Mexico" was the main thrust of future generations widely famous.
sentences.chinese: 其“墨海中立定精神”的主旨被后人广为传颂。

sentences.english: "The sunlight shines his fame, / The winds blaze Lincoln's name." A paean.
sentences.chinese: “阳光照亮了他的声望，风儿则传颂着他的名字”。

sentences.english: He travels the world using a number of names and his adventures are the talk of Paris.
sentences.chinese: 他以多个化名环游世界，他的冒险也在巴黎传颂一时。

sentences.english: His works have been widely read in China with influence on many Chinese poets.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品在中国广为传颂，影响了许多中国诗人。

sentences.english: The Dutch kept the legend of St. Nicholas alive.
sentences.chinese: 荷兰人一直都传颂着圣尼古拉的传说。

sentences.english: The church bells are pealing the message of Christmas joy.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的钟声洪亮地传颂着圣诞快乐的信息。

sentences.english: The story about Kernan was sounded.

definition: (of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
to sing the praises of/to extol/to eulogize
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
deed/past achievement/important event of the past
story or deed that captures the imagination and is spread far and wide
to admire/to revere/to look up to
a good reputation to last down the generations
